17069.quoteText: A pixel tag (also known as a web beacon) is a piece of code embedded in the Services that collects information about engagement on the Services.
17069.title: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.

tosdr.case: You are tracked via web beacons, tracking pixels, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting

17071.quoteText: The Company may terminate your account, delete your profile and any content or information that you have posted on the Services and/or prohibit you from using or accessing the Services for any reason, or no reason, at any time in its sole discretion, with or without notice.
17071.title: The service can delete your account without prior notice and without a reason

tosdr.case: Your account can be deleted without prior notice and without a reason

17072.title: There is a date of the last update of the agreements

tosdr.case: There is a date of the last update of the agreements

17073.quoteText:
“Do Not Track”

Do Not Track (“DNT”) is a privacy preference that users can set in certain web browsers. Please note that we do not respond to or honor DNT signals or similar mechanisms transmitted by web browsers.
17073.title: This service ignores the Do Not Track (DNT) header and tracks users anyway even if they set this header.

tosdr.case: Do Not Track (DNT) headers are ignored and you are tracked anyway even if you set this header.
